concise_definition: v. 投资, 投入, 赋予

definitions.explanation_en: To commit money or capital to a venture, business, or asset with the expectation of gaining a financial return or profit over time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将资金或资本投入某项事业、企业或资产中，期望在未来获得财务回报或利润。
definitions.example_en: She invests a portion of her salary in mutual funds every month.
definitions.example_cn: 她每月将一部分工资投资于共同基金。

definitions.explanation_en: To devote time, effort, or resources into something with the hope of achieving a valuable outcome or personal gain.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将时间、精力或资源投入到某事中，期望获得有价值的成果或个人收益。
definitions.example_en: He invested years of hard work into building his reputation as a scientist.
definitions.example_cn: 他投入了多年辛勤工作来建立自己作为科学家的声誉。

definitions.explanation_en: To endow or bestow a quality, power, or authority upon someone or something, often in a formal or symbolic way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以正式或象征性的方式赋予某人或某物某种品质、权力或权威。
definitions.example_en: The ceremony invested the new mayor with the official insignia of office.
definitions.example_cn: 仪式上正式授予新市长象征职权的徽章。

comparison.analysis: “Spend” (花费) 通常指消耗金钱、时间或资源，且不必然期待回报，常带有一次性或消耗性的含义。例如“spend money on a vacation”。而 “invest” 强调有预期回报的长期投入，具有战略性和增值性。
“Allocate” (分配) 指将资源（如资金、时间）按计划或比例分派给不同用途，强调的是分配行为本身，不隐含回报预期。例如“allocate funds to education”。而 “invest” 不仅分配资源，更强调通过该分配实现增值或收益。
“Commit” (承诺/投入) 与 “invest” 在非金钱语境下常可互换，如“commit time”或“commit resources”。但 “commit” 更侧重于决心或义务的承担，而 “invest” 更强调资源的转化与潜在回报，尤其在经济语境中更具专业性和目的性。
